intro: Scaevola socotraensis, commonly known as the Socotra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid environment. It thrives in well-drained soil and is adapted to the unique climate of Socotra. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
